instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Battery Detection
threads.message:
820-3115-B No Battery Detection

I have noticed:

R5280 has a resistance of 1.5 instead of 2 , resistor itself is fine

Testting at R5280 seems to be where the problem lies if I am not mistaken.

PP3V42_GH3 = 3.4V
SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA = 2.6V

What controls R5280?

I am relatively new, I apologize if I ask any "dumb" questions.

Thank you!

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Battery Detection
threads.message:
R5280/81 are the pull-up resistors for SM Battery Bus.
Check resistance to ground on both lines.
Diode mode, red probe to ground; must get less than 0.5-1% difference...

If notice difference, remove D6950 and check again.
First of all, disconnect BIL conector, J6955.
Post the values found.

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Battery Detection
threads.message:
Diode Mode:
R5281 - .516
R5280 - .607

Diode Mode after Removing D6950:
R5281 - .480
R5280 - .574

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Battery Detection
threads.message:
Still bad...
Did you disconnect J6955?
Next step, desolder ISL6259, let the board cool down and measure again.
If still get difference, SMC issue...
You can try reflow SMC first, or reball it.
But you'll need to change it I suppose.

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Battery Detection
threads.message:
Okay sounds good - Ty

Is ti worth trying to inject voltage into the line and looking for heat/short?
